article.headline: Arkansas State 65, Hampton 57
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- Dewarick Spencer matched his season-high with 31 points and had seven rebounds to lead Arkansas State to a 65-57 win over Hampton in the consolation game of the Golden Bear Classic. Spencer missed only four shots the entire game, connecting on 11-of-13 attempts from the floor while going 3-for-5 from the free throw line for the Indians, who snapped a three-game losing streak with the win on Thursday. Spencer also scored five points and had a key block in the final 2 1/2 minutes of the game when Arkansas State held off a late Hampton rally. Devin Green had 16 points and 10 rebounds to pace four Hampton players in double figures. Brandon Streeter added 12 points for the Indians, who overcame a 14-point deficit to pull within one of the Indians late in the second half before falling short. Hampton, which trailed 38-24 at halftime, scored 16 of the first 20 points in the second half and pulled within 55-54 on Green's short jumper in the lane with 3:31 remaining. But Arkansas State (6-4) went 6-for-7 at the free throw line down the stretch to seal the win. The Indians lost to Pepperdine, 91-82, in a first-round game of the tournament. Spencer, Arkansas State's leading scorer this season, had 18 points in the loss to the Waves and was only 6-for-13 from the floor. Against Hampton (3-8), Spencer found his touch. The only Arkansas State player to reach double figures in every game this season, Spencer didn't take a shot for the first five minutes of the game but still scored 24 points in the first half to match Hampton's team total. Spencer's 31 points were just two shy of the tournament record and just one shy of his career best. Kitus Witherspoon scored 12 points and grabbed eight rebounds for Arkansas State, which won despite being held to a season-low in points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
